summary: This document is an email chain from August 2021 discussing the scheduling of an interview with a second victim who reported being sexually assaulted by 'Black' at Jeffrey Epstein's Manhattan townhouse in 2001. The interview is a spinoff from the Ghislaine Maxwell case and involves coordination between a prosecutor and an FBI agent.

persons.name: Black

persons.name: Maxwell
persons.context: The interview is described as a 'spinoff from the Maxwell case,' indicating the context is related to the investigation of Ghislaine Maxwell.

connections.description: Both are connected to the same network of alleged abuse, with Black's alleged assault occurring at Epstein's property, which is central to the Maxwell case.

events.title: Alleged Sexual Assault by Black

events.description: An interview with a victim was tentatively scheduled for Tuesday, May 18, 2021, as part of a spinoff investigation from the Maxwell case.

events.title: Email Coordination for Interview
events.description: Email correspondence on August 17, 2021, discusses scheduling an interview with a victim's attorney regarding a new allegation.

keyFacts: A second victim reported being sexually assaulted by an individual named 'Black' at Jeffrey Epstein's Manhattan townhouse in 2001.
The victim's attorney contacted prosecutors in 2021, leading to a planned interview as a spinoff from the Ghislaine Maxwell case.
The email chain shows coordination between a U.S. Attorney's Office prosecutor and an FBI agent to schedule an interview with the victim.
The document indicates ongoing investigative activity related to Epstein's network in August 2021, after Maxwell's conviction.
The alleged perpetrator is referred to only by the last name 'Black,' with no further identifying details provided in this excerpt.
